section.text: Are you sure you wish to delete this slot?
Save incomplete - some objects/items/areas may be missing. This is usually because you are missing a mod or the save is from a different version of the game.
Save corrupted! It could not be loaded either because it was a bad save version, or the campaign could not be found or is from a missing mod.
Are you sure you wish to overwrite this slot?
Can only import files on Title Screen.
Do you wish to quit? Any unsaved progress will be lost.
I shouldn't mess with things I don't understand...
Anything entering this teleportal will be instantly transported to the selected teleportal as long as both teleportals are powered and not paused.
Stores items and dispatches them to factories and generators connected by belts. Items can enter any side.
Stores up to 10 items. Can be pushed around.
Generates {power} [tile=power scale=0.25 ignoreHeight] Power/Second while fueled.
Stores {power} power. Charges when there is surplus power on the grid, discharges when there is a deficit.
A place to rest for up to 4 people.\nProduces [tile=gui.oxygen scale=0.5] Oxygen.
Extracts ores from the ground. Requires a worker.
Lights up your base when turned on.
Creates [item=chip]s and tools. Requires a worker.
Lets you travel instantly between this and any other teleportal.
Stalls hunger, heals health, recharges batteries and lets you advance time when sealed inside.
It would be cruel to wake them up before there was a [color=ff2222][text=structure.bunker][/color] for them to stay in.
Would you like to open the [color=ff2222][text=structure.cryopod][/color] and wake {npc} up?
You can't repair the [color=ff2222][text=structure.cryopod][/color] while someone is inside it.
Finish your current conversation before opening the [color=ff2222][text=structure.cryopod][/color]!
Allow survivors to access this storehouse?
If disabled, storehouses will never dispatch items to this structure, it will only use items it has, and items sent to it from producers (like mining rigs).
Splitters will send items to this Storehouse if it is the closest one with high priority.
Splitters will only send items to this Storehouse if there is no connected Storehouse with higher priority.
This Storehouse will not accept items of this type from belts.
Dispatches a specific item to this storehouse from a connected storehouse.
Detects nearby ores of a chosen type.
Can climb, and also connects cables.
Stops water from flowing above it.
Moves items along the ground. Rotates to send items towards structures that need that item (based on priorities).
I'm well rested and off to work!
Nothing beats going home after a long day at work!
The path to my work station is blocked!
The path to my bunker is blocked!
So hungry... can barely keep moving...
We need to build more bunkers, there's no place for me to sleep!
I can't breathe! We need to drain the water from our base!
I can't breathe out there! We need to drain the water from our base!
My bunker's not powered, I can't recharge!
I feel like I'm getting quite good at operating this equipment!
What's it take to get some food around here?
Good day! At least, I think it's day - I can never tell down here...
Finish your current conversation before talking to {name}.
I locked the door out of the lab during the attack - I didn't want to let anything dangerous in!
But, it appears I've misplaced the keycard! Silly me - at least the [color=ff2222][text=structure.teleportal][/color] is functioning!
Are you sure you wish to dismantle this structure?
Your protosuit does not need to be recharged.
The {name} is currently crafting an item.
[text={structure}]s cannot be placed in this area.
There's no water here to carry!
The location is already full of water!
Your [item=mine] is not powerful enough to mine this block!
Cannot mine this block while a structure is on top of it.
This teleportal is disabled! Would you like to enable it?
You need to find a [item=blueprint] to unlock the next upgrade.
[color=ff2222]{name} is hungry and has no food!
[color=ff2222]{name} is trapped and cannot reach their bunker!
I shouldn't mess with the Professor's lab!
This vehicle is being operated by another player!
[shake=2]Good morning![/shake] I am PAI - your Personal AI - and I am here to assist you!
I do apologize for awakening you early, I was programmed to only do so in the most dire of emergencies, but [shake=2]you have slept through the end of the world[/shake].
I am sure you have many questions, but first I have some good news and bad news - which do you want to hear first?
The good news is that, against all odds, you are alive and mostly intact!
The bad news is that there was a cave in, your [color=ff2222][text=structure.cryopod][/color] got damaged, and all signals are down.

This doesn't necessarily mean you are the last human alive - but the last signal I received was about an unknown threat bombarding the surface and causing wanton destruction, which does not bode well for the majority of the human race.
Before you start worrying about the rest of the human race, first you need to focus on your own predicament.
[if={intro}|I'm a little worried about your lack of movement since your awakening. ]Use [key=up][key=left][key=down][key=right] to walk and move your mouse to look around.
[if={intro}|I'm a little worried about your lack of movement since your awakening. ]Use [key=up no_arrow] to walk and [key=look_up no_arrow] to look around.
Your protosuit is equipped with a [item=mine], which will allow you to gather resources to deal with your shelter, power and food needs.

Please note the toolbar at the bottom of your display. You can select what tool to use using [key=tool1][key=tool2][key=tool3][key=tool4][key=tool5][key=tool6][key=tool7][key=tool8][key=tool9][key=tool10].
Please note the toolbar at the bottom of your display. You can select what tool to use using [key=prev_tool] and [key=next_tool].
Oh, you already know how to use the [item=mine]!
To mine, select the [item=mine] and then hold [key=select] to mine a selected wall - this may take time depending on the power of your [item=mine] and the hardness of the cave wall.
I have detected nearby [item=iron] and [item=gold] - Mine some and I can show you how the [item=craft] works!
The [item=mine] also has a flashlight which you can use [key=alternate] to turn on and off while it is selected.[if={intro}| If you have any questions, hit [key=help] to talk to me at any time!]
Now that you have raw ores, you have to process them into building materials in the [item=craft]. Let's turn all that [item=iron] and [item=gold] into [item=steel]s and [item=wire]!
Select the [item=craft] and then hit [key=alternate] to craft items directly into your inventory. You can open your inventory using [key=cancel].

Now lets build a [color=ff2222][text=structure.generator][/color] with those [item=steel]s and [item=wire]s to generate some power! Switch to the [item=build] tool on your toolbar, then hit [key=alternate] to select a structure to place.
Good idea building a [color=ff2222][text=structure.generator][/color] with those [item=steel]s and [item=wire]s!

I'm sure you guessed this already, but red guidelines means you cannot place a structure there, and blue means you can. Try placing the [color=ff2222][text=structure.generator][/color] anywhere there is space, or mining to make space.
When you are close to a structure, you'll see green guidelines around it regardless of what tool is selected.

When these guidelines are visible, hit [key=select] to build or interact with the structure, and [key=alternate] to dismantle the structure. You get 100% of the resources back when you dismantle, but it does take power!
Well, what are you waiting for? Complete the [color=ff2222][text=structure.generator][/color] by holding [key=select] when the guidelines turns green!

To ensure your survival, you'll need a steady supply of power and food. The [color=ff2222][text=structure.generator][/color] will produce energy as long as it has [item=coal] to burn, but you'll need a [color=ff2222][text=structure.battery][/color] to store it.
[color=ff2222][text=structure.hydroponics][/color] will produce [item=tomato default=Tomatoes] as long as it is powered - one should be enough for your personal nutritional needs.

Build a [color=ff2222][text=structure.battery][/color] and [color=ff2222][text=structure.hydroponics][/color] close to the [color=ff2222][text=structure.generator][/color]. Choose the structure using [key=alternate] when the [item=build] is selected (and there's no green guidelines selecting a structure), and then place and build them the same way you did the [color=ff2222][text=structure.generator][/color].
To power the [color=ff2222][text=structure.battery][/color] and [color=ff2222][text=structure.hydroponics][/color], you need to connect them to the [color=ff2222][text=structure.generator][/color].

Buildings adjacent to the generator will auto-connect, but if they are further away you can craft [item=cable]s in the [item=craft] using [item=wire]. You place them from the toolbar, and remove them with [item=mine].

Make sure the [color=ff2222][text=structure.generator][/color] is fueled with [item=coal], and that it is connected to the [color=ff2222][text=structure.battery][/color] and [color=ff2222][text=structure.hydroponics][/color] with [item=cable]s to power them!

Now that you have food and power, things are looking pretty good. At least if you ignore the fact that you're buried deep underground with little chance of reaching a surface which may already be destroyed.
But maybe life won't be so bad down here. You can use the [item=build] to improve this cavern, and you might even find other survivors who got buried down here during the cave in.
Now that you have a place for them to stay, you can wake up a survivor!
Now that we have more hands, it's time to put them to work!
You can assign them to work at [color=ff2222][text=structure.lab][/color]s, which produce tools and upgrades.
Lets build a [color=ff2222][text=structure.lab][/color] and assign our new friend to work there!
The [color=ff2222][text=structure.lab][/color] needs power, materials, and a worker assigned to produce [item=chip]s or tools. That's a lot, but they are worth it!
[item=chip]s can be used by selecting them and hitting [key=alternate], just like the [item=craft].
Take a look at all the different upgrades for your items before choosing one, as each one will require [item=chip]s! [item=mine] [color=ff2222]Strength[/color] will be needed to mine harder stone.
You can change what tool you want to upgrade in the upgrade window - try changing it to [item=mine] to upgrade its [color=ff2222]Strength[/color].
I'm sure you already know this, but as an organic being you do need to eat to survive. You can select food on your toolbar and hold [key=alternate] to eat it.
If you don't have any food handy, you can always turn [item=coal] into [item=nutrient_bar]s with the [item=craft].
Made from fossilized plants, [item=nutrient_bar]s are probably safe for human consumption. But, you may prefer real plants grown in [color=ff2222][text=structure.hydroponics][/color].

[if={intro}|Watch out - you're running low on power! ]Without power, you will not be able to use any of your tools! The best way to recharge is to find a [color=ff2222][text=structure.battery][/color] unit and hold the "Retrieve Battery Power" button.

Your protosuit can also extract small amounts of ambient energy, so if you turn off your flashlight, you can slowly recharge your batteries. The amount of energy produced can be upgraded with [item=chip]s.
You can turn your flashlight on and off by selecting your [item=mine] and hitting [key=alternate] .
With an upgraded [item=mine], we can now reach the [color=ff2222][text=map.old_base][/color] where your [color=ff2222][text=structure.cryopod][/color] fell from.
It would be worthwhile to see if the [color=ff2222][text=structure.teleportal][/color] there is still working - it could be your ticket out of here!
You can use [item=ladder]s and the [item=shovel] to work your way up there, and the upgraded [item=mine] to clear the collapsed stones.
I marked the last known location of the [color=ff2222][text=structure.teleportal][/color]. Look up and head towards my smiling face, and you will find it!
The [color=ff2222][text=structure.teleportal][/color] seems to still be functioning! Lets see if there are any other [color=ff2222][text=structure.teleportal][/color]s to connect to!
If we're lucky, maybe one of the [color=ff2222][text=structure.teleportal][/color]s at the surface will still be powered and functioning, and we can teleport straight there!
What are you waiting for? Select the [color=ff2222][text=structure.teleportal][/color] and see what you can connect to!
Oh, so you repaired the [color=ff2222][text=structure.cryopod][/color]? Given the situation, it doesn't make sense to return to cold sleep.
However, if you step inside a powered [color=ff2222][text=structure.cryopod][/color] and close the door to activate it, it will stall your hunger and restore your health and batteries.
While the [item=craft] is portable, it’s not as efficient as a [color=ff2222][text=structure.factory][/color].

[color=ff2222]Factories[/color] will continue to craft their specified recipe until they run out of materials or power - and they can even request more materials from [color=ff2222][text=structure.storehouse][/color]s connected to them by [item=belt]s.
Now that you have more mouths to feed, it might be a good idea to build more [color=ff2222][text=structure.hydroponics][/color] to make sure everyone stays happy and fed.
I'm afraid to say that all life signs in the area are gone. Needless to say, this does not bode well for the survival of the human race.
Without any workers, you'll need another way to craft [item=chip]s. I'll upgrade your [item=craft] to be able to make them!
And that ends the demo! Time for you to shut down!

[shake=2] Rescue Survivors...

[pause=5]Reach the Surface...[pause=5]

 Rebuild Civilization in...
Before you go hog wild digging holes, I would like to warn you that you cannot fill them until you craft a [item=shovel] in an [color=ff2222][text=structure.lab][/color].
We'll need a [color=ff2222][text=structure.bunker][/color] [item=blueprint] to wake up survivors. Try searching for and dismantling debris from the old base.
This looks like debris from a [color=ff2222][text=structure.bunker][/color].
There were supposed to be many of these for survivors to live in once they awoke - but it looks like they were destroyed.
If you find and dismantle enough debris, I could create a [item=blueprint] for you to build a new [color=ff2222][text=structure.bunker][/color]!
Now I’ll fill in the gaps missing from the scanned debris, and [shake=3]voila[/shake]! One [color=ff2222][text=structure.bunker][/color] blueprint ready to be built!
Once you build a [color=ff2222][text=structure.bunker][/color], we can start waking up other survivors and get a little underground settlement going!
Where did you go? My sensors have gone haywire - perhaps this is an unstable dimension! A place like this will change every time you enter it.
If you plan to go exploring the unknown, you'll need a [item=shovel]. I'll upgrade your [item=craft] to be able to make them!
My name is PAI, not Darkness, but I’m glad we’re friends!
Right. Well then, is it time to return to the surface?
Nope! The surface is destroyed, and we’re stuck down here for the foreseeable future!
[shake=2]Lovely.[/shake] At least that means I get to spend more time in these beautiful caves.
Of course - they are a miner’s dream, with lots of natural ore!
In fact, we should set up a [color=ff2222][text=structure.rig][/color]! Assign me to work at one, and I’ll be able to mine an endless amount of ore!
Well, we’re off to a rocky start!
Absolutely! Do you have any underground survival experience?
I’ll see what I can dig up…
Because I’m a miner? [shake=2]Nobody appreciates a good joke…
Well, it is the end of the world…
Nonsense, the world’s still right here! Even if people die, it’s not going anywhere.
Well, let's try not to let anyone else die…
These caves aren’t so bad - if we set up a [color=ff2222][text=structure.rig][/color], I’ll be able to use it to mine an endless amount of ore!
That’s my hibernation belly speaking. I hope you have something good to eat!
It sounds like I have my work cut out for me! Here, have some [color=ff2222][text=structure.kitchen] Blueprints[/color]!
With it, I can cook up a variety of delicious meals. Just build a [color=ff2222][text=structure.kitchen][/color], supply the raw ingredients and assign me to cook there!
We’re setting up a [color=ff2222][text=structure.kitchen][/color], and we’re working on making better food!
Now that we can make [item=milk], I was thinking it's time to expand our menu!
How about [item=pizza]? One pie makes 6 slices we can share with everyone!
That oughta lighten the mood around here! But it won’t lighten my belly!
Hello! What a lovely day, no?
Is it day? I can never tell down here…
Me neither, but that doesn’t mean it’s not lovely!
The only thing missing is a freshly cooked meal!
But we don’t have a [color=ff2222][text=structure.kitchen][/color] and I don’t know how to cook!
Fear not, my friend, for I know how to make a [color=ff2222][text=structure.kitchen][/color], and know well how to cook!
Simply follow the blueprint to build a [color=ff2222][text=structure.kitchen][/color], supply it with raw ingredients and assign me to cook there, and we’ll have delicious meals in no time!
Heyo! Is it time to return to the surface?
I hate being in dark, enclosed spaces like this!
That’s a real shame, as the surface is possibly destroyed and there will be no returning to it any time soon!
Your PAI is a whole field of cheer, ain’t he?
I suppose everyone will need to chip in. I know a thing or two about crops and [color=ff2222][text=structure.hydroponics][/color].
I also have [item=wheat] and [item=sugar] seeds we can use to grow something a little better than [item=nutrient_bar]s.
We’re going to survive this - and we’re going to return to the surface.
Welcome to the end of the world!
[shake=2]Did you have to wake me up?
Well, we could have left you until your [color=ff2222][text=structure.cryopod][/color] batteries ran out and you died in your sleep.
But being one of the last human survivors, we decided it was better to awaken you and enlist your help!
I don’t see what you expect me to do. I was a farmer - [shake=2]I’m useless for underground survival.
Hmph. Well, I suppose I have [item=wheat] and [item=sugar] seeds we can grow in [color=ff2222][text=structure.hydroponics][/color].
I suppose I can help. Just don’t expect much from me.
Well, looks like I’ve awoken to quite a tricky survival situation!
Let me assure you, it’s far worse than it appears! The surface is destroyed and I am uncertain how many humans survived!
Well, it’s a good thing you found and woke me up - I’m Andromeda, the brightest food scientist in existence!
It was me who invented the Meat Trees for the SPLICER project!
A revolutionary invention! We can use it to grow meat in [color=ff2222][text=structure.hydroponics][/color] without the need to harm or take care of animals down here!
Isn’t it? I’ll make sure we all have a nutritious diet even down here at the end of the world!
Psh - you’re just like the ethics committee. Not everyone can appreciate brilliance.
[shake=3]Whoa there![/shake] Don’t startle me like that, I might shoot!
Survivors? You don’t mean we [shake=3]LOST the WAR?!
[shake=2]Absolutely![/shake] All traces of human civilization are gone!
It’s all my fault! I should’ve been there, fighting!
Sniper. I liked being able to fight from afar, and well hidden.
But, I was scared. They had bigger, and better guns. So, I volunteered for the Cryo Reserve.
I can help you fight, but first we’ll need weapons. You can craft [item=laser_gun]s in the [color=ff2222][text=structure.lab][/color].
You crafted a [item=laser_gun]! Let's show it to [color=ff2222][text=names.soldier][/color] and learn to shoot things!
[item=laser_gun]s are great - you can keep your distance, hide behind blocks and run away before enemies even get close!
Take advantage of the laser targeting to aim, and upgrade their [color=ff2222]Range[/color] when you get the chance with [item=chip]s.

[item=laser_gun]s also come with a shield that you can deploy by holding [key=alternate]. This can protect you when there’s no good cover, and you can even fire while the shield is active - although this will drain through your battery fast.
I will warn you that alien enemies have tough exteriors that laser bolts bounce right off of! You’ll have to find a weak spot if you want to hurt them - you’ll know you got 'em when they flash red!
If you have extra, you could give me a [item=laser_gun] - I might not be much in a fight, but I can certainly shoot those pesky bats!
Unfortunately, the [item=pizza] party has been canceled due to not having a bunker. But you can still eat the [item=pizza]!
Nothing sadder than a [item=pizza] party when you’re all alone.
But I will always be here for you!
Let us commemorate this momentous occasion - our first [shake=2]post-apocalyptic [item=pizza] party!
I will pretend to eat [item=pizza] and be merry while you organic creatures stuff your faces!
[shake=4]This![/shake] This is what I’ve been waiting for! Come to me, oh glorious [item=pizza]!
Good food, friendly company, exceptional atmosphere - c’est magnifique!
This place is great - we’re surrounded by gems and get free [item=pizza]!
All I need is a good drink and this would be perfect - on the rocks of course!
[shake=1]I- I guess it feels a little brighter down here with good food and company.
The [item=pizza]’s good. Don’t know about the company. Or the surroundings.
Mmm… Bio-engineered plant [item=milk] makes for a delicious [item=pizza]. It’s even vegan!
This isn’t so bad. Maybe we should just stay down here where it’s safe… [shake=1]forever…
It’s nice having my workplace connected to the [color=ff2222][text=structure.storehouse][/color] - it can automatically dispatch items to me without having to get them myself.
If we use [item=belt]s to feed items into the [color=ff2222][text=structure.storehouse][/color] faster than I use them, this base could become self-sufficient!
They died. It was very sad.
Is it safe to have a [item=uranium] reactor so close to the base?
It’s no more dangerous than being stuck in a cave with poor airflow that could collapse any minute!
The [item=coal] fumes trapped underground are dangerous too.
Where is all this [item=milk] coming from all of a sudden? Are we raising cows down here?
I see you got a [color=ff2222][text=structure.teleportal][/color] up and running! Does that mean we can return to the surface?
Nope - all of the surface [color=ff2222][text=structure.teleportal][/color]s are no longer functioning.
But we can build a new [color=ff2222][text=structure.teleportal][/color] network to zoom around our base. Isn’t that great?
Increases the drilling power, allowing mining through harder blocks faster.
How much power it drains. Each upgrade uses 1 less power per block.
How far it can reach. Each upgrade gives +50% range.
How bright the flashlight is. Each upgrade gives +66% brightness.
How fast it constructs. Each upgrade makes it 50% faster.
How fast you can move. Each upgrade makes you +33% faster.
Reduces damage of all attacks by 2 for each upgrade.
How power efficient it is. Each upgrade reduces the power usage by 33%.
How much it can carry. Each upgrade adds one row.
How much power your suit generates. Each upgrade generates +75% more power per second.
How much damage each bolt deals. Each upgrade adds +25% more damage.
How much power it drains. Each upgrade uses 1 less power per bolt.
How fast it fires. Each upgrade makes it fire +33% faster.
How far you can collect items from. Each upgrade adds 1/2 tile radius.
Adds 10 to your suit's oxygen storage per upgrade.
Need help or a reminder? Press [key=help]!
Finish your current conversation before asking for help!
When the progress bar reaches 100%, the item will be dropped out of the structure at the [tile=target_arrow scale=0.25].
When the progress bar reaches 100%, one fuel will be consumed.
I'm trying to tell {name} something important, but they are ignoring me! Tell them to pay attention!
The [item=craft] allows you to craft basic necessities using items from your inventory - including [item=nutrient_bar]s for food.

Select the [item=craft] and then hit [key=alternate] to craft items. However, it can only craft one item at a time, so I recommend building a [color=ff2222][text=structure.factory][/color] as soon as you can!
The [item=build] lets you build, dismantle and repair structures.
When selected, you can hit [key=alternate] to select a structure to build, and [key=select] to place the structure.
If the guidelines are red, it means it won't fit in the selected location - try mining out a bigger area, and don’t forget to mine above for taller structures!
You can also rotate the blueprint using [key=rotate_left] and [key=rotate_right].
The [item=shovel] can place infinite amounts of blocks that you have previously mined. It can be crafted at the [color=ff2222][text=structure.lab][/color].
When selected, you can hit [key=alternate] to select what material to place, and [key=select] to place the block.
This is great for replacing holes you mined in your base, and climbing up ramps. You can also rotate ramps using [key=rotate_left] and [key=rotate_right].
The [item=laser_gun] goes pew and can kill enemies from afar. It can be crafted at the [color=ff2222][text=structure.lab][/color].
When selected, you can hit [key=select] to fire the gun, and hold [key=alternate] to bring up a shield that protects you from all harm but drains your battery.
The [item=laser_gun] also has laser targeting - showing you a small red dot where the projectile will hit.
Be careful with dangerous weapons though! We wouldn’t want you to hit your friends and kill one of the last human survivors!
[item=cable]s can be placed to connect structures to [color=ff2222][text=structure.generator][/color]s to provide power.
They can connect to [item=cable]s above and below them - as well as traveling up ramps and through [item=ladder]s to connect structures vertically.
If you place one in the wrong spot, you can remove [item=cable]s with the [item=mine].

[item=belt]s transport items along them in the direction they are pointing. This can be used to transfer items to [color=ff2222][text=structure.storehouse][/color]s, and [color=ff2222][text=structure.storehouse][/color]s will automatically dispatch items onto [item=belt]s to send them to structures that request them.

[item=belt]s can enter structures from any side, but structures only output items in one location. The direction can be rotated when placing [item=belt]s using [key=rotate_left] and [key=rotate_right].

[item=splitter]s are like [item=belt]s, but they can rotate in any direction to move items towards the structure that requested them - allowing one [color=ff2222][text=structure.storehouse][/color] to dispatch to many different structures.
[item=belt]s and [item=splitter]s can also be removed with the [item=mine].
[item=ladder]s can be placed on the walls and climbed to reach new heights! They also can carry power vertically if connected to [color=ff2222][text=structure.generator][/color]s with [item=cable]s.
[item=ladder]s can also be removed with the [item=mine].
In the inventory, you can Shift+[key=select] to transfer the entire stack of an item, and [key=alternate] a stack to pick up half or place one item.
In the inventory, you can [key=rotate_left]+[key=select] to transfer the entire stack of an item, and [key=alternate] a stack to pick up half or place one item.
You can also hold Shift to walk and disable flight (if enabled).
You can also hold [key=rotate_left] to walk and disable flight (if enabled).
[color=ff2222]Survivors[/color] can be found in [color=ff2222][text=structure.cryopod][/color]s, and woken if you have a [color=ff2222][text=structure.bunker][/color] to house them (not full).

They can be assigned to work at an [color=ff2222][text=structure.lab][/color], [color=ff2222][text=structure.rig][/color] or [color=ff2222][text=structure.kitchen][/color], and will work faster as their skill with that equipment increases.

When they get hungry, they will return to their [color=ff2222][text=structure.bunker][/color] to rest and eat. They will automatically collect food from the ground or [color=ff2222][text=structure.storehouse][/color]s if needed - so make sure to keep a stockpile of food and not block their path to the [color=ff2222][text=structure.bunker][/color].
You can also talk to survivors to check in with them, see their stats and skills, and give them items and food.

When the bombardment started and it quickly became clear the surface was lost, humanity began building [color=ff2222][text=structure.bunker][/color]s and [color=ff2222][text=structure.cryopod][/color]s deep underground to protect civilians.
The hope was that after the war was won, the civilians could be woken up and live down there until the surface was terraformed and became habitable again.

However, with all signals down, it appears the war was lost. In addition, the damage was greater than expected - with earthquakes and shifting tectonics, [color=ff2222][text=structure.cryopod][/color]s were separated and [color=ff2222][text=structure.bunker][/color]s destroyed.
On the bright side, it appears the enemy bombers have left, and you’re still alive. Perhaps there’s still hope for humanity to reclaim the surface and recover!

You can also change the fuel to [item=uranium] or [item=exotic_matter], which are rarer but last longer than [item=coal]. The [color=ff2222][text=structure.generator][/color] can also request fuel from [color=ff2222][text=structure.storehouse][/color]s connected by [item=belt]s.

[color=ff2222][text=structure.battery][/color] units store excess power from connected [color=ff2222][text=structure.generator][/color]s, and can provide power to connected structures when there is a temporary shortage, keeping everything from shutting down.
This provides a great buffer for situations where the power requirements increase and decrease, like when [color=ff2222]Factories[/color] turn on and off.
You can also store and retrieve power to the [color=ff2222][text=structure.battery][/color] Unit by interacting with it - one of the easiest ways to recharge your suit.
Having no digestive system myself, I don’t know what the big deal is, but apparently some foods taste better and are more nutritious than others.
The [color=ff2222][text=structure.kitchen][/color] can cook a variety of meals from raw foods as long as it has power and a worker manning it.
The [color=ff2222][text=structure.rig][/color] excavates endless ores from deep underground as long as it is powered and has a worker.

Those ores can be moved to [color=ff2222][text=structure.storehouse][/color]s with [item=belt]s, or directly into [color=ff2222]Factories[/color] and [color=ff2222][text=structure.generator][/color]s to automate your base!

In addition to storing materials, it can also automatically dispatch requested items to structures connected via [item=belt]s. It also displays the first row of items on a screen so you can easily identify and organize your [color=ff2222][text=structure.storehouse][/color]s.
The [color=ff2222][text=structure.bunker][/color] allows up to four survivors to rest and recharge. You can view and manage all the survivors assigned to each bunker.
[color=ff2222][text=structure.bunker][/color]s also produce [tile=gui.oxygen scale=0.5] Oxygen in their interiors - perfect for underwater or moon bases!
You can also use the mirror in the back of the [color=ff2222][text=structure.bunker][/color] to change your appearance.

If you seal yourself inside a powered, repaired [color=ff2222][text=structure.cryopod][/color], you will regain [tile=gui.health scale=0.5] Health and [tile=gui.power scale=0.5] Power, and your [tile=gui.hunger scale=0.5] Hunger will not decrease until you leave.
You can also advance the time of day to any hour, and while that might not matter underground, it could be invaluable on the surface.

[color=ff2222][text=structure.teleportal][/color]s allow you to instantly travel between any powered [color=ff2222][text=structure.teleportal][/color]s, and are a great way to return to your base after a long journey.
[color=ff2222][text=structure.teleportal][/color]s can also take you to any vehicle you have built - but be warned this is a one way trip.
You can even rename [color=ff2222][text=structure.teleportal][/color]s to make it easier to identify which one goes to which location!
I'm sorry to hear that! Would you like me to teleport you back to where you first woke up?
Show enemy health bar when injured.
Allow pickup of moving items (like on belts).
Show output arrow on fully built structures.
